title: Mozzarella Sticks
introduction: These are my grandma's favorite appetizer. You will love them.

steps.subtitle: Get your sticks
steps.instructions: First, you will need to gather your ingredients. Do that first.

title: Ultimate Pancakes
introduction: Back of the Bisquick box! *ingredient = Required for "Ultimate Pancakes".

steps.subtitle: POUR
steps.instructions: Pour slightly less than 1/4 cupfuls onto hot, greased griddle.

steps.subtitle: COOK
steps.instructions: Cook until edges are dry. Turn; cook until golden.

steps.subtitle: Prep
steps.instructions: Mix dry ingredients (except sugar). Whisk sugar and butter. Now whisk in egg and buttermilk until smooth. Stir in dry ingredients with a spatula to form soft, pliable dough. Cover with plastic and refrigerate at least 30 minutes or overnight.

steps.subtitle: Fry
steps.instructions: Heat 1 inch of oil in skillet to 325 degrees. Use spoon to form dough into balls. Drop dough balls into hot oil and fry until golden brown on both sides (about 1-2 minutes on each side). Drain doughnut holes on paper towel. Roll in cinnamon sugar or frosting while still warm.

title: Caramelized Onion Burgers
introduction: With Horseradish Aioli & Carrot Fries. EveryPlate meal.

steps.instructions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry all produce. Halve, peel, and thinly slice onion. Trim, peel, and cut carrots into long thin sticks, like fries. Peel and finely chop garlic. Halve buns.

Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add onion and a pinch of salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, until softened and lightly browned, 8-10 minutes. Cook, stirring, until caramelized and jammy, 2-3 minutes more. Turn off heat; transfer to a small bowl and set aside. Wipe out pan.

While onion cooks, toss carrots on a baking sheet with a drizzle of oil; season with salt and pepper. Roast until browned and tender, 15-20 minutes, then transfer to a plate. Maenwhile, shape beef into two 1/2-inch-thick patties, each a bit wider than a burger bun. Season all over with salt and pepper.
In a second small bowl, combine mayonnaise, a pinch of garlic, and a pinch of wasabi. Season with salt and pepper; stir until very smooth.
Heat a drizzle of oil in pan used for onion over medium-high heat. Add patties and cook to desired doneness, 3-5 minutes per side.

While patties cook, place 1 TBSP butter in a small microwave-safe bowl; microwave until melted, 30 seconds. Brush onto cut sides of buns. Place buns cut sides up on sheet used for carrots. Toast in oven until golden, 3-5 minutes. Fill toasted buns with patties, caramelized onion, and horseradish aioli. Serve with carrot fries on the side.

title: Chicken Salad
introduction: With Horseradish Aioli & Carrot Fries. EveryPlate meal.

steps.instructions: Mix all ingredients together to taste.
As leftovers, you may need to add more mayo.
